definitions.definition: lasting only a short time or containing few words:
examples: His acceptance speech was mercifully brief.

definitions.definition: used to express how quickly time goes past:
examples: For a few brief weeks we were very happy.

definitions.definition: to give someone detailed instructions or information:
examples: We had already been briefed about/on what the job would entail.

definitions.definition: to make information about someone or something public, with the intention of criticizing/praising him, her, or it:
examples: On several occasions government officials briefed against their own ministers.
